translated: The Monastic Code of the Elders
The Great Analysis🔽The chapter on training rules🔽The sub-chapter on sandals
The training rule on head coverings

original: Tena samayena buddho bhagavā sāvatthiyaṁ viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme.
analyzed: tena samayena buddhaḥ bhagavā sāvatthiyam viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme
translated: At one time when the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery,

original: Tena kho pana samayena chabbaggiyā bhikkhū veṭhitasīsassa dhammaṁ desenti …pe….
analyzed: tena kho pana samayena chabbaggiyāḥ bhikkhū veṭhita sīsassa dhammam desenti pe
translated: the monks from the group of six gave teachings to people with their heads covered. …

original: “Na veṭhitasīsassa agilānassa dhammaṁ desessāmīti sikkhā karaṇīyā”ti.
analyzed: na veṭhita sīsassa a gilānassa dhammam desessāmi iti sikkhā karaṇīyā ati
translated: “‘I will not give a teaching to anyone with their head covered who is not sick,’ this is how you should train.”

original: Veṭhitasīso nāma🔽kesantaṁ na dassāpetvā veṭhito hoti.
analyzed: veṭhitasīsaḥ nāma  kesantam na veṭhitaḥ hoti
translated: With their head covered:🔽without showing the top of the head.

analyzed: na veṭhita sīsassa a gilānassa dhammaḥ desetabbo
translated: One should not give a teaching to anyone with their head covered who is not sick.

original: Yo anādariyaṁ paṭicca veṭhitasīsassa agilānassa dhammaṁ deseti, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
analyzed: yaḥ anādariyam paṭicca veṭhita sīsassa a gilānassa dhammam deseti āpatti dukkaṭassa
translated: If a monk, out of disrespect, gives a teaching to someone with their head covered who is not sick, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
if it is unintentional;🔽if he is not thinking;
if he gives a teaching to someone who has uncovered the top of the head;
if he is the first offender.🔽The sixth training rule is finished.
